result.execSummary:
The defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 6.19.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6.19.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
The defendant will not be in custody long enough to qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Duntaye Lovell Bowen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original transcript of proceedings of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing APRIL 20, 2015 received and filed. (38 Pages.)
Parties filed photos to remain in court file just for the record.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel was just appointed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 4.16.15 and for jury trial on 5.27.15.  Motion hearing scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. Defense counsel in intake court today. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 02-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to other jury trial scheduled in court.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr
  Jury trial scheduled for 10-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State unable to proceed, needs witness.   Court ordered case adjourned for suppression  motion and  jury trial in Branch  47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 10-13-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is in trial. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 8/4/2014 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.
to Suppress Physical Evidence, received and filed. sab
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Defense requests speedy jury trial.    Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Pretrial scheduling order signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pro-se Motion and Demand for Discovery received and filed.
Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing MAY 5, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of Bridget Krause for attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Settingsgaard-MCSD Deputy. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF3325 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Duntaye Lovell Bowen in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
